articles.title: 分析：清洁能源2025年为中国GDP增长贡献超过三分之一
articles.summary: 2025年，太阳能、电动汽车及其他清洁能源技术对中国经济增长的贡献已超过三分之一，并拉动超过九成的投资增长。 中国清洁能源行业产值在2025年达到创纪录的15.4万亿元人民币（约合2.1万亿美元），约占国内生产总值（GDP）的11.4%，该数字相当于巴西或加拿大的经济规模。 Carbon Brief基于官方数字、行业数据及分析师报告进行的最新分析显示，2022年至2025年间，中国清洁能源行业的实际规模几乎翻了一番；若将其视为一个独立经济体，其规模可位列全球第八。 该分析的其他主要成果包括： 这些投向清洁能源制造业的资金，代表着对中国乃至全球能源转型的重大押注，也为政府和企业保持这一发展势头提供了动力。 然而，未来的长期走势仍然存在不确定性，尤其是在太阳能领域。受136号文件下的新定价机制影响，太阳能发电装机增速已有所放缓，而中央政府设定的相关目标也明显低于近几年的实际扩张水平。 如果放缓趋势持续下去，这些产业或将从经济增长的驱动力转变为拖累因素，同时加剧工业领域的“产能过剩”问题，并进一步恶化国际贸易摩擦。 但即便中央政府对清洁能源未来五年的目标设定较为谨慎，地方政府和国有企业的规划

This positive trend signals sustained momentum. Businesses are optimistic about the future. Hiring resumed, though at a modest pace. Input and output prices rose moderately. Service providers are managing costs effectively.

articles.title: Jewellery’s Instagram moment; Claude Cowork stirs concerns
articles.summary: Happy Friday! Instagram is driving growth for fashion jewellery brands through discovery-led shopping. This and more in today’s ETtech Morning Dispatch.

articles.title: Scroll, spot, buy: Why fashion and lifestyle shopping is growing on Instagram
articles.summary: For many Gen Z shoppers in their early 20s, shopping via a social media ad while scrolling through the feed is most natural, with impulse purchases offering both retail therapy and instant gratification.

articles.title: Anthropic unveils latest AI model as OpenAI rivalry intensifies
articles.summary: Anthropic on Thursday released its latest high-performing artificial intelligence model, escalating its challenge to OpenAI and Google in the intensifying AI race. Anthropic says its latest model, Claude Opus 4.6, represents a fundamental shift in how AI handles complex workplace tasks.

articles.title: India resets startup definition to include deep tech companies, cooperative societies
articles.summary: India has revised its startup framework, increasing turnover limits, extending eligibility for deep-tech firms, and including cooperative societies in the Startup India programme. Startups can now be recognised up to 10 years, while deep-tech firms have a 20-year window. The changes aim to support innovation, R D, and long-term growth.

articles.title: What is Frontier: The next big enterprise bet from OpenAI?
articles.summary: OpenAI is launching a new service called Frontier. This platform will help companies create and manage artificial intelligence agents. These AI tools can perform specific tasks. This move puts OpenAI in direct competition with rival Anthropic. Both companies are also preparing for public offerings and will run competing advertisements during the Super Bowl.

articles.title: Nykaa Q3 delivers big; AI capex hots up
articles.summary: Nykaa posts strong Q3 results as profits and revenue surge. This and more in today's ETtech Top 5.

articles.title: China warns of security risks linked to OpenClaw open-source AI agent
articles.summary: China’s industry ministry warned that the popular open-source AI agent OpenClaw may create serious security risks if poorly configured, leaving users vulnerable to hacking and data leaks. Officials said some deployments lacked basic safeguards, urging organisations to review network exposure and strengthen access controls. Use continues to grow despite flaws.

articles.title: 'Software-mageddon' leaves investors bargain-hunting but wary
articles.summary: Wall Street's software sector is experiencing a significant downturn, dubbed "Software-mageddon," as investors grapple with the disruptive potential of artificial intelligence. This selloff, marked by substantial market capitalization losses, has led some to consider buying beaten-down stocks, while others await clearer signals of AI integration and its impact on future software sales.

articles.title: Fashion quick commerce startup Zilo raises $15.3 million led by Peak XV Partners
articles.summary: The funding round also saw participation from angel investors including Groww founder and CEO Lalit Keshre, Cred founder Kunal Shah and Ayyappan R, founder of FirstClub. Founded in February last year by Padmakumar Pal and Bhavik Jhaveri, Zilo has already raised nearly $20 million in funding.

articles.title: SpaceX merger provides lifeline for Elon Musk’s debt-ridden AI startup
articles.summary: The company, which owns Musk’s AI startup and the social network X, is saddled with billions of dollars in debt, besieged by well-funded rivals and faces mounting regulatory scrutiny after its chatbot spread sexualized images. It also brings in scant revenue, compared to SpaceX. Much of what it does generate comes from Musk’s other businesses.

articles.title: Funny but dishonest: Sam Altman blasts Anthropic’s ChatGPT Super Bowl ad jab
articles.summary: Altman took aim at Anthropic’s national campaign, which shows a generic AI chatbot interrupting users with intrusive product advertisements. The video ends with the tagline: “Ads are coming to AI. But not to Claude.” — a reference to Anthropic’s chatbot, Claude.

articles.title: AI job fears trigger IT selloff; Unmesh Sharma sees opportunity for Indian IT, not doom
articles.summary: Indian technology stocks experienced a sharp decline following AI breakthroughs. However, an expert highlights that India's strength lies in AI implementation rather than core innovation. Electronics manufacturing services are identified as a multi-year growth sector. Investors are advised to navigate volatility with a focus on structural themes and disciplined positioning for future gains.

articles.title: India bonds jump on US deal boost; profit-taking caps rise before RBI meet
articles.summary: Indian government bonds rallied early Tuesday following a U.S.-India trade deal, sparking hopes of increased foreign inflows due to a stronger rupee. However, profit-taking limited major moves as investors await the central bank's monetary policy decision. The benchmark 10-year bond yield eased after being pressured by high borrowing projections.

articles.title: Technical analysts suggest buy on Cummins, Dalmia Bharat, CAMS, Jubilant FoodWorks, Grasim; sell call on HCLTech
articles.summary: On Friday, market tech analysts Mitessh Thakkar and Sudeep Shah recommended these stocks for the short term.

articles.title: Average US long-term mortgage rate barely budges, holding near 6%
articles.summary: The average long-term U.S. mortgage rate barely budged this week, staying close to 6% as the spring home-buying season nears.

articles.title: Will this be the biggest IPO of the year so far?
articles.summary: India’s first unicorn plans a domestic listing with $4-5 bn valuation range; pre-IPO round and reverse flip underway, say sources

articles.title: Bitcoin's monthslong slide continues, hitting fresh 15-month low of $67,000
articles.summary: The original cryptocurrency, pitched as “digital gold,” has lost 46% of its value since Oct. 6, when it hit a record high of $126,210.50, according to crypto trading platform Coinbase.

articles.title: Operation Sindoor | Tom Cooper’s new book claims India dominated May 2025 conflict with Pakistan
articles.summary: Tom Cooper’s book 88-Hours War claims India gained air superiority over Pakistan in May 2025, following the Pahalgam attack, shifting the regional balance of power.

articles.title: VA Tech Wabag posts strong Q3, profit jumps over 30% as revenue and operations grow steadily
articles.summary: VA Tech Wabag Limited posted 30.6 percent net profit growth to ₹91.7 crore and 18.5 percent revenue rise in Q3, with improved margins, but shares closed lower at ₹1,194 on NSE.

articles.title: Top stories: PM Modi in Rajya Sabha, stocks slide, RBI MPC tomorrow, HAL chief on fighter jet race & more

articles.title: 18 killed in suspected illegal coal mine blast in Meghalaya; probe ordered
articles.summary: Rescue teams have since recovered 18 bodies, Superintendent of Police Vikash Kumar confirmed, while search operations remain underway to trace others who may have been inside the mine at the time.

articles.title: Swiss watch brand Atlantic Watches plans to double India stores as demand for mid-priced luxury watches grows
articles.summary: After a strong first year in India, Swiss watchmaker Atlantic Watches is scaling up its retail presence, banking on rising demand for mid-priced luxury timepieces and India’s growing relevance in the global Swiss watch industry.

articles.title: Tanker Crash | Mumbai-Pune Expressway traffic chaos continues, tolls halted
articles.summary: Toll collection on Mumbai–Pune Expressway was suspended after a propylene gas tanker overturned near Adoshi tunnel yesterday (Feb 3) evening, causing a 12-hour traffic halt and major disruption in Raigad district.

articles.title: S&P Global-HSBC PMI: India’s services activity rebounds in January, jobs growth nearly flat
articles.summary: Rise in new export businesses helped push the growth with demands increasing from Indonesia, Qatar, Sri Lanka and Vietnam. As a result, the numbers expanded fastest since November.

articles.title: India-US trade deal lifts market mood, industry sees relief for key export sectors
articles.summary: Industry leaders Rajiv Memani, Amit Kalyani, Sanjay Budhia and Suvankar Sen welcome the India-US trade deal, citing tariff relief and improved export prospects.

articles.title: Impact of AI on jobs is still unfolding, says CEA; assures of markets turnaround
articles.summary: Post-Budget 2026 | Chief Economic Adviser V Anantha Nageswaran said the labour market impact of AI is still at an early stage in India and globally; potential disruptions being addressed by focusing on skilling initiatives and jobs in sectors less likely to be affected by AI, such as allied healthcare economy, tourism, and the orange economy; cautioning that incentives alone cannot drive private capex and that the current state of global funk may continue for a few more years.

articles.title: CEA Nageswaran: India growth story intact despite valuation worries, global uncertainty
articles.summary: Chief Economic Adviser told CNBC-TV18 that FII outflows, US policy uncertainty and sector issues weigh on markets, but India’s growth story and fundamentals remain strong despite volatility.

articles.title: Gemini to exit EU, UK, Australia; cuts 25% of workforce as tech stocks slide
articles.summary: Gemini exits EU, UK, Australia, cutting 25% of staff. Tech stocks tumble, Qualcomm down 11%, Alphabet 7%, Hims & Hers rises, gold miners fall 4%.

articles.title: No country is AI-ready: Pearson CEO flags skill gaps in India, warns of vocational shortage
articles.summary: India and other major economies face deep-rooted workforce challenges as artificial intelligence accelerates, with Pearson Global CEO Omar Abbosh warning that shortages in vocational skills and educator preparedness could slow inclusive AI adoption.

articles.title: Mad Over Donuts initiates minority stake sale amid flurry of dessert deals
articles.summary: Gourmet doughnut chain Mad Over Donuts explores private equity investment with teasers having been sent to prospective suitors amid deal buzz in India’s QSR and dessert segment.

articles.title: AI is making skills go obsolete faster, so learning how to learn is the real job now: Pearson CEO
articles.summary: As AI tools rapidly take over routine professional tasks, Pearson Global CEO Omar Abbosh says continuous learning—not static qualifications—will determine who stays relevant in the workforce, as companies and employees confront a multi-year disruption driven by artificial intelligence.

articles.title: Inside the Leap to Unicorn Top 100: The startups shaping India's next decade
articles.summary: How Leap to Unicorn is building one of India's most credible discovery pipelines for early stage ventures.

articles.title: HAL dismisses delay claims, says fighter jet project won't hit growth
articles.summary: DK Sunil, Chairman and Managing Director of Hindustan Aeronautics Limited, said that even in a worst-case scenario, the AMCA programme does not impact HAL’s near- or medium-term financial outlook. He noted that since production is expected only around 2035, revenues from AMCA have never been included in the company’s current business plans.

articles.title: Eicher delivers 13.5m electric sleeper bus for intercity routes; 35 by March 2026
articles.summary: Eicher Trucks & Buses has delivered its first 13.5m electric intercity sleeper coach, with 35 buses set for North India routes by March 2026 through operator LeafyBus.

articles.title: Washington Post cuts a third of its staff, including Ishaan Tharoor
articles.summary: The Washington Post laid off one-third of its staff, cut its sports section and foreign bureaus which included Ishaan Tharoor, the son of Congress MP Shashi Tharoor. WaPo's decision sparked outrage from figures like Nancy Pelosi and Martin Baron over journalism’s future.

articles.title: 11:11 | AI arms race intensifies and investors are getting nervous
articles.summary: AI optimism is colliding with investor anxiety as Big Tech splurges, chipmakers face pressure and geopolitical grip tightens further.

articles.title: ElevenLabs raises $500 million in Series D as enterprise voice AI drives $11 billion valuation

articles.title: Nvidia's AI chip sale to ByteDance hinges on conditions set by Trump administration
articles.summary: The US may let ByteDance buy Nvidia H200 chips, but Nvidia has not agreed to US KYC conditions. China approved imports for ByteDance, Tencent, Alibaba, and Deepseek amid ongoing tech tensions.

articles.title: AI is the new oil: Nations, not companies, are racing for global dominance
articles.summary: Hemant Mohapatra of Lightspeed Venture Partners says the global AI race is increasingly being shaped by national control over chips, data, and foundation models. As countries build their own AI ecosystems, India’s push for sovereignty through local data, domestic model-building, and semiconductor manufacturing could determine its place in the future AI order.

articles.title: No more test runs: Gatik says driverless trucks are now a real, money-making business
articles.summary: Autonomous freight startup Gatik says driverless trucking has reached real commercial scale, with Fortune 50 retailers committing hundreds of millions of dollars to its services. CEO Gautam Narang highlights safety-led deployment, Nvidia-backed technology partnerships, and an aggressive fleet expansion plan that could see hundreds of fully driverless trucks on US roads by year-end, with India on its long-term radar.

articles.title: SEBI tightens expiry-day margins for single-stock derivatives; calendar spread benefit withdrawn
articles.summary: SEBI has withdrawn calendar spread margin benefits on the expiry day for single-stock derivatives to curb sudden margin shocks, aligning rules with index derivatives and strengthening risk management.

articles.title: Big Tech stocks pull Wall Street lower again
articles.summary: Technology stocks led a U.S. market drop as S P 500 fell 0.9%, Nasdaq 1.6%. Alphabet, Qualcomm, Estee Lauder shares sank. Bitcoin hit a 15-month low. Gold and silver prices tumbled.

articles.title: Retail investors sell into February rally as FPIs turn buyers post US deal

articles.title: ABFRL's sales grow, but losses deepen in Q3 even as stock ends higher
articles.summary: Aditya Birla Fashion and Retail Ltd posts Q3 net loss of ₹152.2 crore despite 7.9% revenue growth. Earnings before interest, tax, depreciation and amortisation (EBITDA) increased 2.4% to ₹308.6 crore from ₹301.5 crore a year earlier.

articles.title: IT services pricing at risk as AI alters tech spending: Gartner
articles.summary: John-David Lovelock, VP & Distinguished Analyst, Gartner, said hardware and software segments are seeing pricing support from AI adoption, while IT services face pricing pressure as clients demand productivity gains. IT services companies that shift toward AI-led solutions and partnerships may perform better in the current environment.

articles.title: Berger Paints Q3: Volumes jump over 8%, profit declines as scale, brand spends weigh
articles.summary: Berger Paints posted flat revenue and an 8% YoY profit decline in Q3, offset by strong volume growth, record gross margins and management optimism on improving demand trends.

articles.title: J Kumar Infraprojects sees weaker Q3 after monsoon disruptions
articles.summary: Net profit falls 17.2% to ₹82.8 crore; revenue, EBITDA and margins also see moderation

articles.title: Tamil Nadu Minister says North Indians 'clean tables,' sell 'pani puri'; BJP calls it 'reckless and dangerous'
articles.summary: Speaking at an event in Chengalpattu, Panneerselvam talked about people from North India working in low-paying jobs.

articles.title: Heated exchange between Rahul and MoS Ravneet — From 'my traitor friend' to 'Desh ke dushman'
articles.summary: Rahul Gandhi called Ravneet Singh Bittu a traitor at Parliament during Congress protests over MM Naravane's memoir; eight MPs were suspended.

articles.title: Took refuge in lies: Rahul slams PM Modi over his Rajya Sabha address
articles.summary: Rahul Gandhi accused Narendra Modi of avoiding tough questions and lying in Rajya Sabha, while Modi countered by alleging Congress insulted the President, tribals, Dalits, and the northeast.

articles.title: Over 3,800 Indian nationals deported from US in 2025: Government tells Parliament

articles.title: Thums Up drops ‘Taste the Thunder’ anthem, fans go wild over the ‘masterpiece’
articles.summary: The track is written by Hanumankind and Varun Grover and composed by Sushin Shyam. Just in time for the ICC Men’s T20 World Cup, the music video features Indian cricketers Suryakumar Yadav and Rinku Singh.

articles.title: Seychelles President Patrick Herminie on first India visit as ties reach 50 years
articles.summary: Patrick Herminie arrived in India on his first official visit, marking 50 years of diplomatic ties. He will meet Droupadi Murmu and Narendra Modi to boost maritime and regional cooperation.

articles.title: After 8-hour jam, Pune industrialist takes helicopter as expressway stays shut 33 hours
articles.summary: Pune industrialist Sudhir Mehta took a helicopter after being stuck for hours on the Mumbai-Pune Expressway, where an overturned gas tanker halted traffic for over 30 hours, stranding thousands.

articles.title: 3 sisters, out to get photocopies of their Aadhaar cards, go missing in UP's Jaunpur
articles.summary: The three sisters allegedly left home to get photocopies of their Aadhaar cards, but did not return home.

articles.title: Sharad Pawar holds two meetings with late Ajit Pawar's sons
articles.summary: Sharad Pawar met Parth and Jay Pawar in Baramati to discuss Vidya Pratishthan projects and possible NCP merger ahead of Zila Parishad polls. Ajit Pawar memorial was not discussed.

articles.title: ED cracks down on ₹658 crore fake ITC racket; searches across Bengal, Jharkhand and Manipur
articles.summary: Searches underway in Jharkhand, Manipur, Kolkata and other states by ED’s Itanagar zonal unit.

articles.title: India revises recognition criteria for startups to promote AI, deep-tech innovation
articles.summary: India has notified revised startup recognition norms, confirming CNBC-TV18’s January 28 newsbreak, raising turnover limits, introducing a deep-tech category and expanding eligibility to cooperatives to boost innovation-led growth.

articles.title: Apple begins hiring for retail roles in Hyderabad
articles.summary: Apple has issued a job notification seeking outlet managers and retail managers, among other roles, to be based here, sparking speculation that the iPhone maker may open a retail store in the city.

articles.title: Is it time to buy IT stocks yet? BOB Capital’s Girish Pai answers
articles.summary: Girish Pai, Research Analyst and Head of Institutional Equity Research at BOB Capital Markets, prefers BPO-focused companies and named Firstsource and eClerx as stocks he is more comfortable with at current levels.

articles.title: Arm Holdings stock sinks over 8% as memory chip shortage fears hit phone production
articles.summary: Arm and Qualcomm shares dropped as memory chip shortages hurt phone output; AI demand shifts supply to data centers. Samsung, SK Hynix, and Micron lead.

articles.title: Explained — Why Nvidia, Broadcom shares rose after Alphabet's capex announcement
articles.summary: Unlike many peers that rely heavily on industry-standard Nvidia processors, much of Google’s AI software runs on its in-house TPUs. The company’s latest flagship model, Gemini 3, was trained using these proprietary chips. Broadcom works with Google on the design and manufacturing of its TPUs.

articles.title: Exclusive | AI is a once-in-a-century opportunity for India: Mukesh Ambani
articles.summary: Mukesh Ambani and Larry Fink believe India is uniquely positioned to lead the global AI revolution, with Reliance placing a major bet on the technology as the country’s next growth engine. From transforming education and healthcare to boosting productivity, AI could redefine India’s economic standing over the next two decades.

articles.title: Sam Altman 'excited' to get Elon Musk under oath: What's Tesla CEO's lawsuit against OpenAI, Microsoft
articles.summary: Sam Altman teased Elon Musk over his lawsuit against OpenAI and Microsoft, which seeks up to 134 billion dollars. The trial starts in April in Oakland, California.

articles.title: Google warns 40% of Android phones vulnerable to new malware attacks
articles.summary: Only 7.5% of phones were running the most recent operating system, Android 16, when the data was collected in December.

articles.title: This Silicon Valley veteran is 'disoriented' with rise of AI; others say humans still valuable
articles.summary: Aditya Agarwal, Sam Altman, Francois Chollet, and Jensen Huang reflect on AI's impact, as coding shifts from manual craft to AI-driven problem-solving and validation in tech industry.

articles.title: Nvidia nears deal to invest $20 billion in OpenAI round

articles.title: Nazara Technologies says core business improving, more acquisitions on radar
articles.summary: Nitish Mittersain, Joint MD and CEO of Nazara Technologies said that the company saw about 10% organic revenue growth and more than 25% profitability growth, excluding acquisitions and deconsolidation. The company invested about ₹500 crore in acquisitions last year and has about ₹700 crore in net cash. The company may raise capital if required, but no decision has been finalised.

articles.title: Sam Altman says OpenAI to work with 'extremely powerful models' soon: What it means

articles.title: Anthropic’s new AI tool is threat to which companies and services — and what's next
articles.summary: The concern is no longer about AI supporting existing models, but replacing entire layers of corporate work. Anthropic's new AI tools, and the rapid evolution of AI capabilities is forcing investors to reconsider long-standing assumptions about the defensibility of data, research and software subscription businesses.

articles.title: Google Chrome unveils Gemini 3-powered ‘auto browse’: What it does and risks

articles.title: PayPal replaces CEO Chriss with HP's Enrique Lores

articles.title: Nvidia CEO says AI build-out will eventually lower energy costs

articles.title: Memory chip price surge biggest near-term risk for smartphones, says Dixon CFO
articles.summary: Saurabh Gupta, Director–Finance and Group CFO of Dixon Technologies, said sharply rising memory chip prices, which have nearly doubled, are seriously hurting the low-end smartphone market. He added that this cost pressure has already contributed to a 7% market decline in the previous quarter and will remain a key factor to watch for the industry.

articles.title: NATO wargame shows Russia conquers the Baltics in days as US holds back and Europe hesitates
articles.summary: A German-led wargame suggests Russia could secure key objectives in the Baltics within days by exploiting alliance hesitation and political ambiguity.
